In some cases, cities are bifurcated into municipalities, which can lead to cities being included within other cities. This list is based on the Census o
The list includes the cities and not urban agglomerations.
The cities listed in bold are the capitals of the respective state or union territory and New Delhi, the capital of India.

json_ld.name: Top 10 largest cities in India by population

json_ld.articleBody: As of 2024, Delhi, also known as the capital of India holds the position of the most populous city in India, proclaiming a humongous population of over 33.8 million. Delhi is believed to be an indispensable historical, political, and cultural hub. In this article, weâ€™ll explore in-depth the key features of Delhi while also uncovering the top 10 most populous cities in the country, based on the latest rank list from the UN World Urbanisation Prospects. Political and cultural significance Delhi is not only known to be the political core of India but it also represents the countryâ€™s substantially rich cultural heritage. Consisting of significant landmarks including the Red Fort and India Gate, the beautiful city showcases a perfect blend of modernity and ancient traditions. Its astonishingly diverse population contributes to a dynamic artistic community, making it a cultural mosaic of lifestyles, languages, and religions. This union territory is home to the Parliament House, Supreme Court, PM house, RBI and much more. Economic framework Did you know that Delhi stands among the largest commercial hubs in the country? The vibrant city isnâ€™t just a core of activity and diversity, itâ€™s also the center of substantial multinational corporations, startups, and numerous other industries that fuel its economy. This economic progressiveness captivates individuals from all across the country, emphasizing its responsibility as well as its position as a note-worthy metropolitan region. Educational institutions Delhi is known to be a hub of some of Indiaâ€™s and even the worldâ€™s most distinguished educational institutions, including the University of Delhi and Jawaharlal Nehru University. These notable institutions facilitate a significantly rich intellectual environment, captivating students and young professionals from a diverse range of backgrounds and regions. Top 10 most populated cities in India Rank Cities State/UT Population 1. Delhi New Delhi 33,807,403 2. Mumbai Maharashtra 21,673,570 3. Kolkata West Bengal 15,570,786 4. Bangalore Karnataka 14,008,262 5. Chennai Tamil Nadu 12,053,697 6. Hyderabad Telangana 11,068,877 7. Ahmedabad Gujarat 8,854,444 8. Surat Gujarat 8,330,528 9. Pune Maharashtra 7,345,848 10. Jaipur Rajasthan 4,308,510 Notable comparisons Mumbai Mumbai, in the second position among the top 10 cities, has a huge population of approximately 21.7 million people. This city is known to be Indiaâ€™s financial capital while also being significantly popular for its Bollywood film industry. Often referred to as the â€˜City of Dreamsâ€™, Mumbai- - formerly known as Bombay captivates individuals from all around India in search of good job opportunities and a vibrant modern living. The cityâ€™s culture comprises dynamic and diverse backgrounds, with a wide range of festivals being celebrated over the year. The lively streets of Mumbai are filled with life, from traditional local markets to breathtaking beaches. It plays a significant part in Indiaâ€™s economy, being home to several corporate headquarters as well as financial institutions. Kolkata With a substantially large population of approximately 15.6 million, Kolkata is also renowned as the â€˜Cultural Capital of India.â€™ It has deep roots in literature, music, and art. This beautiful city is immensely popular for the breathtaking celebrations of its significant festivals such as - - Durga Pooja, which catches the attention of tourists from around the world. Kolkata is also known to be a notable educational center, with several renowned colleges and universities. It consists of a beautifully unique blend of modern and traditional living styles, showcasing its remarkability in cuisine and architecture. The economy of this city is significantly diverse, with capabilities in trade, services, and manufacturing industries. The diverse culture attracts tourist all around the year. It offers not only sensory experience but the lush gardens and colonial-era monuments helps you transcend time. Bangalore At the fourth rank, we have Bangalore, also sometimes known as Bengaluru. It is home to over 14 million people and is referred to as the â€˜Silicon Valley of Indiaâ€™, considering its flourishing technology sector. This lively city is a notable region for tech companies and startups, making it a highly popular destination for young professionals as well as students. Bangalore has a dynamic cultural setting, with a number of gardens, parks, and enthusiastic festival celebrations, showcasing its diverse population. The cityâ€™s climate is known to be pleasant all over the year, contributing greatly to the high-quality living. Bangalore is also famous for its note-worthy educational institutions which make this city an important destination for research and learning. In a nutshell, Delhi, with its vast population and significance as Indiaâ€™s political, cultural, and economic hub, leads the list of the country's most populous cities. Alongside Delhi, cities like Mumbai, Kolkata, and Bangalore showcase diverse lifestyles, rich cultural heritages, and thriving economies, making each city a unique contributor to Indiaâ€™s growth. As these urban centers continue to evolve, they remain crucial in shaping the nationâ€™s future.

h1: 15 Largest Cities in India, Ranked by Population

paragraphs: India, a land of incredible diversity and culture, is home to some of the most populous cities in the world. Each of the largest cities in India features its own blend of history, tradition and modernity, showcasing the country's rich heritage and rapid development. From bustling metropolises to his

The vast majority of states within India feature cities of over 1 million residents, so population boom is not a rarity. Whether you're exploring ancient landmarks, indulging in local cuisine or witnessing technological advancements, India's largest cities offer an unforgettable experience.

We used official Indian government data from all respective municipal corporations to rank population numbers. Where firsthand data for Indian cities was unavailable, we went by the UN World Urbanisation Prospects estimates, which were last updated in 2018. It's also worth noting that the last full-

India's capital city and the heart of the Delhi union territory, New Delhi is a sprawling blend of ancient history and modern development. From historic landmarks like the Red Fort and Qutub Minar to bustling markets like Chandni Chowk, Delhi is a cultural treasure trove. Its vibrant arts scene and

Both New Delhi and Mumbai have the distinction of populations exceeding 10 million people, giving them the title of "megacities" among the world's largest metropolitan projects. The neighboring sister city of Old Delhi is also home to some 11 million people, giving a total population of nearly 30 mi

paragraphs: India is a country in South Asia and is the seventh-largest country by geographical area, the most-populous country with more than 1.4 billion people, home to nearly 17.5Â percent of the world's population.[1] India consists of twenty-eight states and eight union territories.[2]

The first official population census of India was conducted in 1872 and every ten years since 1951 by the office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner under the Ministry of Home Affairs.[3][4] The last official census was conducted in 2011.[5] The next census due in 2021 was delayed due t

As per Government of India, an urban agglomeration (U.A.) is a continuous urban spread constituting a town and its adjoining outgrowths (OGs), or two or more physically contiguous towns together with or without outgrowths of such towns. An Urban Agglomeration must consist of at least a statutory tow

Following is the list of urban agglomerations in India with a population of more than one million as per the 2011 census. As per the 2011 census, there were 52 (according to provisional census results, 53[8]) urban agglomerations or cities with population of one million and above.[9][a][8]

As per Demographia, an urban built-up area consists of all continuous and non-continuous urban areas within a metropolitan area. As per the 2023 report, there were 65 urban areas with more than one million inhabitants in India.[11]

paragraphs: Government data for the population in the last 10 years is not available, as there was no census in 2021. The last census was in 2011; this list is based on the projection and analysis of 2011 data by the UN and compiled by Statista.

According to the latest projection, Delhi is expected to have a population of 34.67 million, growing from 16.34 million in 2011. This is nearly 112 per cent growth. This is driven by the trend of rapid urbanisation towards Delhi from various parts of the country, especially from North and Central In

Mumbai has seen enormous growth in population since 2011. In the 2011 census, Mumbai city in the metro region had approximately 18.39 million population. Now, the 2025 projections put the number at 22.09 million.
The 2025 projection puts the population of Kolkata at 15.85 million, increasing from 14.03 million in the 2011 census.

India's Silicon Valley is at 4th with a projected population of 14.40 million in 2025, increasing from 8.52 million in 2011. The expansion of the tech sector, the startup ecosystem and the majority of technocratic talent seeking white collar jobs are contributing to the increased migration towards B
search_snippet: 2 days agoBengaluru India's Silicon Valley is at 4th with a projected population of 14.40 million in 2025, increasing from 8.52 million in 2011.
